---
title: "kubernetes.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines authentication settings for a Kubernetes-related application or service. It specifies that authentication is required and enables the Kubernetes authentication method.

## Symbols

### `authentication`
#### Description
The root configuration block for authentication settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets authentication as required for the system.
- Defines available authentication methods, with Kubernetes being the only method specified in this configuration.

### `authentication.required`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether authentication is mandatory for the system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| required | boolean | Determines if authentication is required |

### `authentication.methods`
#### Description
A block defining the available authentication methods.

### `authentication.methods.kubernetes`
#### Description
Configuration for the Kubernetes authentication method.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables the Kubernetes authentication method for the system.

### `authentication.methods.kubernetes.enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether the Kubernetes authentication method is enabled.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Determines if Kubernetes authentication is enabled |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Specifies if authentication is mandatory |
| authentication.methods.kubernetes.enabled | boolean | true | Enables Kubernetes authentication method |

This configuration file sets up a simple authentication scheme where authentication is required, and the Kubernetes method is the only enabled authentication method. This suggests that the associated application or service is designed to work within a Kubernetes environment and relies on Kubernetes-specific authentication mechanisms.
